alert.note: Alert for Bucks; Montgomery; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 27 at 5:44PM EDT until June 27 at 9:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Bucks County in southeastern Pennsylvania... East Central Montgomery County in southeastern Pennsylvania... Northeastern Philadelphia County in southeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 945 PM EDT. * At 544 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. * Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Philadelphia, Bensalem, Abington, Bryn Athyn, Northeast Philadelphia, Feasterville-Trevose, Feasterville, Willow Grove, Churchville, and Cornwells Heights-Eddington. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 345 and 354. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 39. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
